title: Upright Stalking Technique
brief: Move silently in upright position using controlled foot placement and weight distribution.
steps: Step 1: Take steps about half your normal stride length to maintain balance.
Step 2: Curl toes up when stepping so outside edge of ball of foot touches ground first.
Step 3: Feel for sticks and twigs that may snap - lift foot and move it if you detect any.
Step 4: Roll from outside ball of foot to inside ball, then place heel down, followed by toes.
Step 5: Gradually shift weight forward to front foot before lifting back foot.
Step 6: Lift back foot to about knee height and repeat process.
Step 7: Keep hands and arms close to body - place hands on knees when crouching.
Step 8: Take approximately 1 minute per step, adjusting for situation.
warnings: You must be able to stop and hold position at any point during step.
Waving arms or hitting vegetation will create noise and movement.
Practice is essential - stalking is ineffective without training.
One careless step can undo hours of careful movement.
